data.title: The Science Fiction Book Club
data.meta_description: Book: John Wyndham - The Outward Urge - The Science Fiction Book Club - Hardcover - UK (1961)
data.text:
ppint.

7th Jul 2024

contents:

the space-station: A.D. 1994 (novelette) new worlds #70, 4/1958 as ''for all the night''; fantastic vol.7 #11, 11/1958 as ''the troons of space''

the moon: A.D. 2044 (ntte) new worlds #72, 6/1958 as ''idiot's delight''; fantastic vol.7 #12, 12/1958 as ''the troons of space - A.D. 2044''

mars: A.D. 2094 (ntte) new worlds #73, 7/1958 as ''the thin gnat-voices''; fantastic vol. 8 #1, 1/1959 as ''the troons of space - mars A.D. 2094''

venus: A.D. 2144 (ntte) new worlds #75, 9/1958 as ''space is a province of brazil''; fantastic vol. 8 #2, 2/1959 as ''the troops of space - venus A.D. 2144''

the emptiness of space: the asteroids A.D. 2194 (short story) new worlds #100, 11/1960; amazing vol.35 #1, 1/1961

''the emptiness of space'' had the date added in amazing and ''the asteroids'' added for book publicationppint.

11th May 2021

all penguin books uk p/b printings are of the complete series;

all ballantine books mmpb printings contain only the four novelettes, as does the 1965 ''bal-hi'' edition.ppint.

11th May 2021

first sfbc h/cvr printing, first edition of the complete family troon series

cover (d-j) art design by c. w. bacon (signed cwb)

cover price 5/6 (for sale only to sfbc members)

208pp. including titles, indicia etc. sewn in signatures and bound with endpapers between covered boards

collection of four novelettes and a short story all originally published as by john wyndham:

wyndham introduced his technical advisor alter ego as an explanation of why the stories in this collection were written in a completely different style to that of his novels published as being solely by john wyndham...

appearances in fantastic and amazing were accompanied by their own b+w illustration by virgil finlay:David Whiteley

6th Jan 2022

The last line of my notes should read: "John Wyndham's alter ego Lucas Parkes wasn't credited when the stories were published in New Worlds.", but the last three words disappeared into outer space due to the deadly character count cropper.

(this comment is from another edition of this book)ppint.

16th Sep 2020

both collaborators are one and the same person, now best known as john wyndham, employing two of his given names as one author, and two further as his technical advisor, ''lucas parkes'';

up to the end of the fourth decade of the twentieth century, he was most commonly published as john beynon: when your name is ''john wyndham parkes lucas beynon harris'', you're spoilt for choice!

see the sfbc h/cvr edition listing for contents and original publication dates.

(this comment is from another edition of this book)ppint.

27th Oct 2018

john wyndham parkes lucas beynon harris was published under many perms and coms of and from his name (q.v), including this auto-collaborative by-line, his most commonly-used derived pseudonyms after john wyndham being john beynon and john beynon harris.

see the sfbc h/cvr edition listing for contents and original publication dates.

(this comment is from another edition of this book)
